dublin_core.dcvalue: Thanks to fluorescence single nano objects down to individual fluorophores can now be imaged in optical microscopes Fluorescence imaging is still restricted to laboratory facilities as it usually involves expensive and bulky instrumentation A report by Wei et al in this issue of ACS Nano however shows that a sensitive cost effective and portable device can be developed to image individual nano objects as small as large viruses This work opens the fascinating prospects of single molecule microscopy and spectroscopy on a smart phone We speculate on the possible applications of such a portable imaging device and on the perspectives it may open in different fields of science and technology
Toward single-molecule microscopy on a smart phone.
